title: Collective Variables of Fermions and Bosonization
abstract: We first present a general method for extracting collective variables out of non-relativistic fermions by extending the gauge theory of collective coordinates to fermionic systems. We then apply the method to a system of non-interacting flavored fermions confined in a one-dimensional flavor-independent potential. In the limit of a large number of particles we obtain a Lagrangian with the Wess-Zumino-Witten term, which is the well-known Lagrangian describing the non-Abelian bosonization of chiral fermions on a circle. The result is universal and does not depend on the details of the confining potential.
